title: Limits the annual increase in debt of the New York city municipal water finance authority to six percent without the approval of the New York city council
summary: Limits the annual increase in debt of the New York city municipal water finance authority to six percent without the approval of the New York city council.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3302

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  BRENNAN,  MILLMAN, LANCMAN, MAISEL, PHEFFER,
         BARRON, PERRY, COOK, WEPRIN -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of  A.  GLICK,
         GOTTFRIED,  MENG  -- read once and referred to the Committee on Corpo-
         rations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to debt held  by
         the New York city municipal water finance authority

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 3 of section 1045-d of the  public  authorities
    2  law,  as added by chapter 513 of the laws of 1984, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    3. To borrow money and issue negotiable or non-negotiable notes, bonds
    5  or other obligations and to provide for the rights of the holders there-
    6  of, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT SUCH POWER TO BORROW MONEY AND ISSUE NEGOTI-
    7  ABLE OR NON-NEGOTIABLE NOTES, BONDS OR OTHER OBLIGATIONS SHALL BE LIMIT-
    8  ED TO THE LIMITATION ON THE ANNUAL INCREASE IN  DEBT  AS  SET  FORTH  IN
    9  SECTION ONE THOUSAND FORTY-FIVE-AA OF THIS TITLE;
   10    S  2.  Sections  1045-aa and 1045-bb of the public authorities law are
   11  renumbered sections 1045-bb and 1045-cc and a  new  section  1045-aa  is
   12  added to read as follows:
   13    S  1045-AA.  LIMITATION  ON DEBT INCREASE. BEGINNING WITH THE NEW YORK
   14  CITY FISCAL YEAR BEGINNING JULY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND  TWELVE  AND  ENDING
   15  JUNE THIRTIETH, TWO THOUSAND THIRTEEN, THE ANNUAL INCREASE IN TOTAL DEBT
   16  HELD  BY THE AUTHORITY AT ANY TIME DURING A FISCAL YEAR SHALL NOT EXCEED
   17  SIX PERCENT OF THE TOTAL DEBT HELD BY THE AUTHORITY DURING THE PRECEDING
   18  FISCAL YEAR WITHOUT THE APPROVAL BY MAJORITY VOTE OF THE NEW  YORK  CITY
   19  COUNCIL.
   20    S  3.  The  public  authorities law is amended by adding a new section
   21  1045-g-1 to read as follows:
   22    S 1045-G-1.   ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF  BOARD  MEMBERS.  1.  BOARD
   23  MEMBERS  OF  THE  WATER BOARD SHALL: (A) EXECUTE DIRECT OVERSIGHT OF THE

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06049-01-1

       A. 3302                             2

    1  BOARD'S CHIEF EXECUTIVE  AND  OTHER  MANAGEMENT  IN  THE  EFFECTIVE  AND
    2  ETHICAL  MANAGEMENT OF THE BOARD; (B) UNDERSTAND, REVIEW AND MONITOR THE
    3  IMPLEMENTATION OF FUNDAMENTAL  FINANCIAL  AND  MANAGEMENT  CONTROLS  AND
    4  OPERATIONAL DECISIONS OF THE BOARD; (C) ESTABLISH POLICIES REGARDING THE
    5  PAYMENT  OF  SALARY,  COMPENSATION  AND REIMBURSEMENTS TO, AND ESTABLISH
    6  RULES FOR THE TIME AND ATTENDANCE OF, THE CHIEF  EXECUTIVE  AND  MANAGE-
    7  MENT;  (D)  ADOPT  A CODE OF ETHICS APPLICABLE TO EACH OFFICER, DIRECTOR
    8  AND EMPLOYEE THAT, AT A MINIMUM, INCLUDES THE STANDARDS  ESTABLISHED  IN
    9  SECTION  SEVENTY-FOUR  OF THE PUBLIC OFFICERS LAW; (E) ESTABLISH WRITTEN
   10  POLICIES AND  PROCEDURES  ON  PERSONNEL  INCLUDING  POLICIES  PROTECTING
   11  EMPLOYEES FROM RETALIATION FOR DISCLOSING INFORMATION CONCERNING ACTS OF
   12  WRONGDOING,  MISCONDUCT, MALFEASANCE, OR OTHER INAPPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR BY
   13  AN EMPLOYEE OR BOARD MEMBER OF THE WATER BOARD, INVESTMENTS, TRAVEL, THE
   14  ACQUISITION OF REAL PROPERTY AND THE DISPOSITION OF  REAL  AND  PERSONAL
   15  PROPERTY  AND THE PROCUREMENT OF GOODS AND SERVICES; (F) ADOPT A DEFENSE
   16  AND INDEMNIFICATION POLICY  AND  DISCLOSE  SUCH  PLAN  TO  ANY  AND  ALL
   17  PROSPECTIVE BOARD MEMBERS; AND (G) AT THE TIME THAT THE MEMBER TAKES AND
   18  SUBSCRIBES HIS OR HER OATH OF OFFICE, EXECUTE AN ACKNOWLEDGMENT IN WHICH
   19  THE BOARD MEMBER ACKNOWLEDGES THAT HE OR SHE UNDERSTANDS HIS OR HER ROLE
   20  AND RESPONSIBILITIES IMPOSED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.
   21    2.  BOARD  MEMBERS  OF  THE  WATER BOARD, OR SUBSIDIARY THEREOF, SHALL
   22  ESTABLISH AN AUDIT COMMITTEE TO BE COMPRISED  OF  NOT  LESS  THAN  THREE
   23  INDEPENDENT  MEMBERS,  WHO SHALL CONSTITUTE A MAJORITY ON THE COMMITTEE,
   24  AND WHO SHALL POSSESS THE NECESSARY SKILLS TO UNDERSTAND THE DUTIES  AND
   25  FUNCTIONS  OF  THE AUDIT COMMITTEE; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT IN THE EVENT
   26  THAT A BOARD HAS LESS THAN THREE  INDEPENDENT  MEMBERS,  THE  BOARD  MAY
   27  APPOINT  NON-INDEPENDENT  MEMBERS  TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, PROVIDED THAT
   28  THE INDEPENDENT MEMBERS MUST CONSTITUTE A MAJORITY OF THE MEMBERS OF THE
   29  AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE SHALL RECOMMEND TO THE BOARD  THE  HIRING
   30  OF A CERTIFIED INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM FOR SUCH BOARD, ESTABLISH THE
   31  COMPENSATION  TO BE PAID TO THE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND PROVIDE DIRECT OVER-
   32  SIGHT OF THE PERFORMANCE OF  THE  INDEPENDENT  AUDIT  PERFORMED  BY  THE
   33  ACCOUNTING  FIRM HIRED FOR SUCH PURPOSES. MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
   34  SHALL BE FAMILIAR WITH CORPORATE FINANCIAL AND ACCOUNTING PRACTICES.
   35    3. BOARD MEMBERS OF THE WATER  BOARD,  OR  SUBSIDIARY  THEREOF,  SHALL
   36  ESTABLISH  A GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE TO BE COMPRISED OF NOT LESS THAN THREE
   37  INDEPENDENT MEMBERS, WHO SHALL CONSTITUTE A MAJORITY ON  THE  COMMITTEE,
   38  AND  WHO SHALL POSSESS THE NECESSARY SKILLS TO UNDERSTAND THE DUTIES AND
   39  FUNCTIONS OF THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE; PROVIDED, HOWEVER,  THAT  IN  THE
   40  EVENT  THAT  A  BOARD HAS LESS THAN THREE INDEPENDENT MEMBERS, THE BOARD
   41  MAY  APPOINT  NON-INDEPENDENT  MEMBERS  TO  THE  GOVERNANCE   COMMITTEE,
   42  PROVIDED  THAT THE INDEPENDENT MEMBERS MUST CONSTITUTE A MAJORITY OF THE
   43  MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE. IT SHALL BE THE  RESPONSIBILITY  OF
   44  THE  MEMBERS  OF  THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE TO KEEP THE BOARD INFORMED OF
   45  CURRENT  BEST  GOVERNANCE  PRACTICES;  TO  REVIEW  CORPORATE  GOVERNANCE
   46  TRENDS; TO RECOMMEND UPDATES TO THE BOARD'S CORPORATE GOVERNANCE PRINCI-
   47  PLES;  TO  ADVISE  APPOINTING  AUTHORITIES ON THE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES
   48  REQUIRED OF POTENTIAL BOARD MEMBERS; TO EXAMINE ETHICAL AND CONFLICT  OF
   49  INTEREST  ISSUES;  TO  PERFORM  BOARD SELF-EVALUATIONS; AND TO RECOMMEND
   50  BY-LAWS WHICH INCLUDE RULES AND PROCEDURES FOR CONDUCT  OF  BOARD  BUSI-
   51  NESS.
   52    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to debt held by the New York city municipal water finance authority
